or having a drip to speed 
up your labour;
• you are less likely to 
request diamorphine or an 
epidural;
• you are less likely to have 
a caesarean section, or to 
need ventouse (vacuum) or 
forceps to assist with the 
birth of your baby;
• you are less likely to need a 
blood transfusion for your 
baby;
• your baby is less likely to 
need to go to a neonatal 
unit;
• you are more likely to 
breastfeed successfully (if 
this is your choice);
• most MLUs support 
partners to stay overnight.
